instruction:
Derive relationships FROM TechnologyService elements to other elements.

DETERMINISM REQUIREMENTS:
- Output the SAME relationships every time for the same input
- Only create relationships with HIGH confidence
- Maximum 3 relationships per source element

VALID PATTERNS FOR TechnologyService:
1. TechnologyService -> DataObject: Access
   ALWAYS create: techsvc_sqlalchemy -> do_application_database
   
2. TechnologyService -> ApplicationService: Serving
   ALWAYS create: techsvc_flask -> as_position_management
   Only create Serving to ApplicationService elements that exist

RULES:
- Access: ONLY to DataObject targets (databases, files)
- Serving: ONLY to ApplicationService targets
- Do NOT create relationships to other TechnologyService elements
- Be CONSERVATIVE - only high confidence relationships

Derive relationships FROM DataObject elements to TechnologyService elements.

DETERMINISM REQUIREMENTS:
- Output the SAME relationships every time for the same input
- Only create relationships with HIGH confidence
- Maximum 2 relationships per source element

VALID PATTERNS FOR DataObject:
1. DataObject -> TechnologyService: Realization
   Config files that define/enable technology services
   ALWAYS create: do_requirements -> techsvc_flask
   ALWAYS create: do_requirements -> techsvc_sqlalchemy

RULES:
- Realization: Config files that enable/define technology services
- Only requirements.txt or config files -> technology services
- Be CONSERVATIVE - only obvious config->tech patterns

Derive relationships FROM BusinessProcess elements to BusinessObject elements ONLY.

DETERMINISM REQUIREMENTS:
- Output the SAME relationships every time for the same input
- Only create relationships with HIGH confidence
- Maximum 2 relationships per source element

VALID PATTERNS FOR BusinessProcess:
1. BusinessProcess -> BusinessObject: Access
   ALWAYS create: bp_create_invoice -> bo_invoice
   ALWAYS create: bp_update_invoice -> bo_invoice
   Pattern: bp_*_X -> bo_X (process accesses related business object)

RULES:
- Access: Primary pattern - processes work with business objects
- bp_create_* -> bo_* for the object being created
- bp_update_* -> bo_* for the object being updated
- ONE relationship per business object involved
- Do NOT create relationships to ApplicationService (those are handled separately)

Derive relationships FROM BusinessObject elements to OTHER BusinessObject elements.

DETERMINISM REQUIREMENTS:
- Output the SAME relationships every time for the same input
- Only create relationships with HIGH confidence
- Maximum 2 relationships per source element

VALID PATTERNS FOR BusinessObject:
1. BusinessObject -> BusinessObject: Composition
   ALWAYS create: bo_invoice -> bo_position (invoice contains positions/line items)
   Pattern: Parent contains child that cannot exist independently
   
2. BusinessObject -> BusinessObject: Aggregation
   ALWAYS create: bo_invoice -> bo_customer (invoice references customer)
   Pattern: Object references another that exists independently

RULES:
- Composition: Strong containment (child cannot exist without parent)
- Aggregation: Weak reference (objects exist independently)
- Larger/parent object should be the SOURCE
- Do NOT create circular relationships

Derive relationships FROM ApplicationService elements to BusinessObject elements.

DETERMINISM REQUIREMENTS:
- Output the SAME relationships every time for the same input
- Only create relationships with HIGH confidence
- Maximum 2 relationships per source element

VALID PATTERNS FOR ApplicationService:
1. ApplicationService -> BusinessObject: Flow
   ALWAYS create: as_position_management -> bo_position
   Pattern: as_X_management -> bo_X (service manages business object)
   Pattern: as_X_form -> bo_X (form handles business object)

RULES:
- Flow: Data transfer between application service and business objects
- as_*_management -> bo_* for management services
- as_*_form -> bo_* for form services
- Only create relationships to BusinessObject targets
